terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.subtitle: The rules of the game (no lawyers involved)

whatIsThis.title: What is this
whatIsThis.p1: The Impostor is a party game to play with friends. One of you doesn't know the secret word and has to blend in while the others describe it. Simple, fun, and sometimes very tense.
whatIsThis.p2: By using this app, you agree to these terms. If you don't like them, sorry, but we can't change them just for you.

rules.title: Play fair
rules.intro: This is a social game. The point is to have fun with friends, not to ruin anyone's day. Basic rules:
rules.rule1: Don't be toxic. No insults, harassment, or behavior that ruins the experience for others.
rules.rule2: Don't cheat. If you're the impostor, own it. If you're not, don't leak the word to anyone.
rules.rule3: Don't use the app for anything illegal. This includes offensive content, spam, and anything that could get us in trouble.
rules.rule4: Respect other players. Behind every username is a real person.
rules.rule5: If you get caught, accept defeat gracefully. And if you win, don't be insufferable about it.

account.title: Your account
account.p1: To play, you need to sign in with Google or GitHub. This gives us access to your email and name, nothing else. We don't access your contacts, photos, files, or anything weird.
account.p2: Your account is yours. Don't share it with anyone. If someone does bad things with your account, you're responsible.

content.title: Content you create
content.p1: You can suggest words for the game. These words go through a filter before entering the database. We reserve the right to reject any word without explanation (although usually it's because it's offensive, too obscure, or just bad).
content.p2: By suggesting a word, you give us permission to use it in the game. We won't give you credits or royalties. It's a contribution to the common good.

consequences.title: If you misbehave
consequences.p1: If you do things that aren't cool, we can take action. This includes but is not limited to:
consequences.p2: There's no appeals court. This is a free game, not a constitutional right. If you think we made a mistake, you can write to us, but we don't promise anything.

disclaimer.title: The typical disclaimer
disclaimer.p1: The Impostor is provided as-is, without warranties of any kind. We don't guarantee it will always work, that it won't have bugs, or that it will exist forever.
disclaimer.p2: We're not responsible for what happens during games. If your friends discover you're a terrible liar, that's on you. If you lose an epic game due to a bug, sorry but we can't compensate you.
disclaimer.p3: This is a personal project made with love. We do what we can to make it work well, but we're not a company with infinite resources.

changes.title: Changes to these terms
changes.content: We can update these terms whenever we want. If the changes are significant, we'll try to let you know somehow. But ultimately, it's your responsibility to check them from time to time.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: What data we have and what we do with it

intro.title: In short
intro.p1: We store the minimum needed for the game to work. We don't sell your data, we don't do weird things with it, and we're not interested in spying on you.
intro.p2: That said, here are all the details because we like transparency.

collect.title: What data we collect
collect.intro: Depending on how you use the app, we store different things:

auth.title: When you sign in (Google/GitHub)
auth.item1: Your unique user ID (generated by Supabase)
auth.item3: Your profile name (you can change it)

game.title: During the game
game.item1: Your player name (the one you choose to display)
game.item2: Words you suggest (if you choose to suggest any)

local.title: In your browser (localStorage)
local.item2: Session data so you don't have to sign in every time

use.title: What we use your data for
use.intro: Only for what we need. Specifically:
use.item1: Let you play games and keep your session active
use.item2: Show your name when you play
use.item3: Know who suggested each word (for moderation)
use.item4: Improve the game (if we see something failing a lot)

thirdParties.title: Third parties that handle your data
thirdParties.intro: We use external services to make this work:
thirdParties.supabase: Database and authentication. They store your profile and manage login.
thirdParties.oauth: Only to verify your identity. We don't access any other data from your account.
thirdParties.rae: For the random word mode. We don't send your data to RAE, we only request words.
thirdParties.noSell: We don't sell your data. We don't share it with advertisers. We don't do invasive analytics. Period.

retention.title: How long we keep your data
retention.item1: Your profile: as long as you have an active account
retention.item2: Games: not stored. When the game ends, everything is deleted
retention.item3: Suggested words: indefinitely (they're part of the game)

rights.title: Your rights
rights.intro: Even though this is a free game, you have rights over your data:
rights.item1: You can ask us to delete your account and all your data
rights.item2: You can ask us for a copy of the data we have about you
rights.item3: You can change your profile name whenever you want
rights.contact: To exercise these rights, write to us. We don't have a fancy form, but we read all emails.

security.title: Security
security.p1: We use HTTPS for everything. Passwords are managed by Supabase (we don't even see them). Database access is restricted.
security.p2: That said, nothing is 100% secure. If someone hacks Supabase, there's little we can do. But we do what's in our power.
